answers.answer: If it was me....I would find a new Dr who actually specializes in thyroid disease. I self pay for mine as he isn't under my insurance plan. Life is too short to waste time with these idiots. This is your life.
Thanks.  My doc is an endocrinologist unfortunately lol.
Believe it or not, most endo's are diabetes specialists and not thyroid specialists.

question: Hi everyone.  I had posted here a few years ago, but haven't been back since.  I was diagnosed with a multinodular goiter and hashimoto's a few years back.  When I went to get the biopsy of my thyroid, the nodules had disappeared.  My TSH stayed between 2.75 and 4 for the most part.  I took 1/2 of the lowest dose of levothyroxine every other day.  I required very little.  When my doc had me taking a 1/2 every day I went hyper so he took me off of thyroid meds completely.  That caused my TSH to shoot up to 18 in a month.  Everything was fine until 6 weeks ago I couldn't breathe.  My heart started racing and I went to the E.R.  They tested my TSH which was .001.  The doc took me off of thyroid meds again.  A month ago it had went up to .2, but is still hyper.  I am waiting to see him on Wed, but I can't stop having panic attacks and heart racing.  They put me on topral for the heart rate, but it does little for the constant attack.  I have to constantly drink anxiety teas and I do not want to take xanax and become addicted.  The docs have offered me little help, telling me it is all in my head.  I am not sure if my TSH is still hyper of back to hypo now, but I'm so frustrated with constant panic.  I have tried eliminating gluten as I read that could cure hashimotos.  I was up all night with panic attack and palpitations though.  Has anyone else ever experienced this?  Is there any help?  Should I get my thyroid out?  Does anyone know of any good docs in Michigan or around toledo Oh.  My insurance only covers one guy, and I'm not too happy with his non-answers.  I am really struggling to live a normal life, and I am tired of everyone telling me this is in my head.  I have never had a panic attack before the day I found out my thyroid was .001.  Thanks for any help.Danielle
title: Hypo to hyper and panic help!
